title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) COMMUNITY & INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: 2.3 More vulnerable populations benefit from sustainable safe water supply and basic sanitation services at community and institutional levels, which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable, have improved access to equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation, hygiene practices and healthy environments

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in peri-urban and urban communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
